txt.en: Talk to Fastrith
Protect the artists assembling the mosaic
'Once more, my friends! Protect our prince and the artists!'
'There must be something else, my prince.'
'If returning the hammer was sufficient, the goblin would have seen it.'
'Behold the death of Mótsog the Traitor, my prince.'
'My prince, do you hear something?'
'Am I certain? Of course I am!'
Durin stands in the chamber of Zul-mazal, ready to learn whatever secrets may remain between its walls.

'For how long has this door remained hidden beneath Zul-mazal, [placeholder]? The secret craft of ancient dwarves masked it from detection by the Orcs who long resided in the mountain, but it could not escape my notice.

'It was no simple mechanism that hid this trap-door for all these years, but also the working of an ancient spell. Two keys served to keep it secret, for so long as the mosaic remained incomplete and the mithril hammer was absent, none could open the passage. Now we have turned both keys, and it is time to see what lies beneath the cold stone of Zul-mazal.

'Leave the mithril hammer where it lies, and I will instruct Bósi and these others to stand guard. You and I will climb through the trap-door, [placeholder], and we will see what there is to see, and learn what we may of Gundabad's secrets.'
'But nothing happens. Perhaps this was not the key?'
'How else could it look?'
The dwarves have been defeated, and you have failed!
'I think I hear the hobgoblins return!'
'What? Bah! When does the master heed the words of his apprentice?'
'Aye. Perhaps then.'
DNT - Blah!

'There is something here, [placeholder]. I am certain of it. Is this room, like others in the Pit of Stonejaws, the tomb of a forgotten noble?\n\n'My eye is drawn to the structure in the centre of the chamber. There is a hole in the top of that curious block; it leads me to believe no body ever lay within.'
'We will clear the stones and begin anew.'
Stáli the Hewer believes his time has come at last.
Durin has come to the chamber of Zul-mazal with the intention of laying bare its mysteries.
'But what does it show?'
'You are in luck, Prince Durin!'
The dwarves believe they have uncovered the key to the mystery of Zul-mazal.
'Come, Fastrith.'

'Can this be anything but the work of the First Crafter, who made the dwarves? How else would the most renowned sculptor of his day, by which I mean ME, the great Stáli the Hewer, come to this chamber at this time?\n\n'I need not wait for Prince Durin's command. I will restore this mosaic to its original state, and no reward will be too great for the work at hand!'
'You will help me assemble the mosaic.'
Talk to Durin
'First let us remove the stones so we can begin fresh.'
Protect the artists assembling the mosaic
'All right...'
'Carefully... carefully...'
Bósi and Durin have heard the sounds of approaching enemies.
'This is delicate work...'

'The hobgoblins must have sent a raiding-party in search of plunder, but they will discover their deaths by the blade of the Red Axe instead!\n\n'We will not let them disturb the work of Stáli and Fastrith, but they are more than welcome to be a part of our own work, [placeholder]: for that work is the slaying of hobgoblins!'
Talk to Stáli the Hewer
'Over here... and over here...'
'Nothing?'
'It is finished!'
'A secret passage!'
Stáli and Fastrith have finished assembling the mosaic.
Fastrith has had an idea.

'A mosaic is not a painting, [placeholder]. You can change the picture by putting the stones in different places. What if... what if the mosaic Stáli assembled beneath the Lonely Mountain is not the same as this one after all?\n\n'What if this mosaic once displayed a different picture than that one?'
Witness the completion of the mosaic
Fastrith is eager to carry out her idea.
Witness the completion of the mosaic... again
Bósi, former leader of the Iron Garrison, has warned you that more hobgoblins approach.
Observe the completed mosaic
Stáli and Fastrith have once again finished assembling the mosaic.
DNT - Blah!
'Hmm... this must be where Glúrkub found the mithril hammer.'
'Let us return it, for now, and see if anything reveals itself.'
Durin and the dwarves examine the chamber for clues.
'When he is commanded to do so by his prince, perhaps?'
'Ah, well-spotted, Bósi!'
'I don't understand.'
'But what else must be done?'
'I suppose it is possible. There is some enchantment here.'
'I do! Hobgoblins!'
'Protect Stáli and Fastrith! They must finish the mosaic!'
'I see it, Stáli. Very impressive.'
'Are you certain the mosaic is complete, Stáli?'
You and the dwarves have uncovered the secret of Zul-mazal, and now Durin must decide what should be done.
'I thought I heard a sound.'
'Fastrith was right! That was the key!'
Talk to Bósi
'Perhaps the mosaic must be intact?'
Talk to Durin
'Beautiful! What a work of art!'
'Well, I wonder...?'
Remain vigilant while the dwarves consider the chamber
'I think we need to start over. I have had an idea!'
Observe the restoration of the mosaic
'You see, we start like so...'
'And then a little more...'
'Yes, this is coming along!'
'I think the picture is complete!'
'Mótsog and Durin were friends before they were foes. Perhaps...'
Instance: The Mystery of Zul-mazal
Talk to Durin
